2054.subject: HPWE
2054.descrlong: Students complete a minimum of 80 hours of fieldwork during this program. Agencies are approved by the Human Performance and Wellness Education department faculty based on the opportunities available for students to work on issues of importance in health and wellness, and the agency's ability to provide mentoring and organization support for the student intern. Check with the Human Performance and Wellness Education department for specific topic. (Offered only as interest warrants.)

2063.descrlong: Students complete a minimum of 80 hours of fieldwork during this program. Agencies are approved by the Human Performance and Wellness Education department faculty based on the opportunities available for students to work on issues of importance in health and wellness, and the agency's ability to provide mentoring and organization support for the student intern. 2064.subject: HPWE
2064.descrlong: Requires instructor consent. Students pick a special topic, project, or internship of interest but must prepare in advance a draft proposal of what they want to do and why, learning outcomes to be targeted, and a basic plan of how they will proceed.  Topics might be research or practically oriented and may, with approval, be done over the semester on campus, in a local community, or in an agency.  Instructor provides guidance and feedback over the term, but students also have ample opportunity to pursue their special interests and develop more challenging skills.

2072.subject: HPWE
2072.descrlong: Combination of theoretical base established in Health and Wellness with applied experience designed for each individual interest area.  (Offered only as interest warrants.)
